data.meta_description:
Global Energy Group | 76,131 followers on LinkedIn. An energy sector service group, delivering strategic excellence across construction, maintenance & enhancement solutions | Founded in 2005, Global Energy Group is a leading service and contracting company. With strategic bases in Aberdeen, Edinburgh, and Inverness (Headquarters), the Group delivers strategic excellence across the energy industry with construction, maintenance, and enhancement solutions.

GEGroup leads through the capability and expertise of its services, facilities, and people, across a wide range of sectors – Renewables, Oil & Gas, Water Treatment & Hydro, and Nuclear.
data.text:
Congratulations to our Commercial Manager, Daniel Cormack, who completed a charity swim across the Cromarty Firth on Sunday 11th August, along with his wife Rachael and Uncle Mark. Together they raised over £2,400 for the RNLI Invergordon Lifeboat Station, celebrating its 50th anniversary this year! The lifeboat station (RNLI 13-27), has been a cornerstone of the Invergordon community, providing invaluable services and ensuring safety in the Cromarty Firth and further at sea. In showing their appreciation for the vital services of the RNLI, the three braved the cool waters of the Firth, swimming from the Black Isle to the Lifeboat Station. #CharitySwim #InvergordonLifeboat #RNLI

Global Energy Group is committed to supporting and developing the future workforce! Recently, we had the pleasure of hosting Adam Slotwinski from Dingwall Academy for a student work experience. Adam's enthusiasm for engineering was evident from the start, and it was fantastic to see his passion grow as he learned about our work across the energy industry. Adam shared: "The experience at Global Energy Group was truly great and opened my eyes to what goes on in the field of engineering. I'm extremely lucky to have spent time here, and what I've seen and the conversations I've had will play a big part in planning my journey into the engineering world. Thank you and all the best for the future." We're thrilled to have been part of Adam's journey and wish him all the best for the future! #WorkExperience #FutureEngineer

Congratulations to Daniel Nicholson, Welding Engineer at Global Energy Group Fabrication, who has completed his International / European Welding Engineer (IWE / EWE) qualification. This is a testament to his hard work and dedication, resulting in Daniel becoming an invaluable member of the Fabrication team, demonstrating technical skills and an excellent work ethic in all projects he undertakes. We sat down with Daniel to learn more about his career to date, the journey to achieving the IWE / EWE qualification, and his ambitions for the future. Read the full story here: https://lnkd.in/d65nfQGU #WeldingEngineer #Fabrication #StaffRecognition

We’re delighted to have partnered with Apollo and the Offshore Renewable Energy Catapult on a critical study on the ‘Tow to Port’ operations for Floating Offshore Wind Turbines. The study provides a better understanding of the opportunities and challenges with disconnecting floating offshore wind turbines from the array and transporting them to port for major operation and maintenance (O&M). Hrishikesh Atitkar, T&I Engineer at Global Energy Group said: “The industrialisation of Floating Offshore Wind is set to revolutionise Scotland’s energy landscape, with enhanced port infrastructure essential to unlocking this technology. Global Energy Group is delighted to have collaborated in this critical T2P study, focused on optimised O&M strategies to ensure floating wind's competitiveness and long-term success.” Access the full report here: https://lnkd.in/dHZinddc #FloatingOffshoreWind #EnergyTransition #OperationsandMaintenance

With over 40 years of experience, our fabrication facility in #Aberdeen is one of the leading locations to support the offshore energy industry. Located in the Nord Centre, our facility offers over 3,000m2 of dedicated fabrication workspace and direct access to Port of Aberdeen’s Clipper Quay, for efficient load-out operations. Boasting a successful project track record, we can complete fabrication projects of all sizes and levels of complexity. Our experienced and highly knowledgeable team ensures the delivery of optimum project solutions to meet our clients' stringent standards. Learn More Here: https://lnkd.in/dpVJwiBz #Fabrication #OffshoreEnergy #Aberdeen

Congratulations to our Executive Director, Iain Sinclair, on his appointment as a non-executive director to the board of Offshore Wind Growth Partnership – the UK’s flagship supply chain growth funding and business support organisation dedicated to offshore wind. “We are delighted to welcome Iain Sinclair, whose wealth of experience in manufacturing, ports and other critical areas will be highly valued as OWGP takes its next steps to help UK companies scale.” - OWGP Programme Director, ANIL SAYHAN “It is great to have Iain on the OWGP Board. Iain joins us at a pivotal time for OWGP as we seek to align our programmes more closely with the recently published Industrial Growth Plan and roll out new initiatives such as our forthcoming Manufacturing Facility Support Programme." - OWGP Chair, Tim Pick MBE #OffshoreWind #RenewableEnergy #NetZero

Global Energy Group takes immense pride in its longstanding commitment to developing the next generation of talent through our highly sought-after apprenticeship programme. This commitment, along with the dedication, hard work, and eagerness of our apprentices, has been key to the success of our specialist fabrication facilities at Aberdeen and Nigg. We would like to take this opportunity to shine the spotlight on the significant contributions of our apprentices and highlight the vital role that apprenticeship programmes play in our industry. These programmes are essential for attracting, retaining, and developing talent across our region, ensuring a robust and skilled workforce for the future. Our four-year apprenticeship programme comprises both practical and theoretical work and culminates in achieving a Modern Apprenticeship in Fabrication and Welding Engineering. The apprentices develop the essential skills and experience needed to work in a modern industry environment. We take great pride in the accomplishments of all our apprentices. Notably, one of our apprentices in Aberdeen has been nominated for the Best Fabrication/Welding Apprentice Category at Tullos Training’s Annual Awards Ceremony, highlighting exceptional talent and dedication within our programme. Read the full article for more information on our apprenticeship programme and to learn how to register your interest in being part of our next cohort of Fabrication apprentices: https://lnkd.in/dQNnM5uS Lisa Winchester, Graeme Webster, Dave Mackay #ApprenticeSpotlight #FutureTalent #Fabrication
